claim: Among female patients with negative anti-scl70 results and no recorded symptoms, the average household income was below the national median.
extra_info: normal anti-scl70 refers to SC170 IN('negative', '0'); female refers to Sex = 'F'; does not have any symptom refers to symptoms IS NULL; Should consider DISTINCT in the final result;
reasoning: The claim references 'average household income' and 'national median income,' but the database contains no income-related data whatsoever. The database only has clinical/medical data (patient demographics, examination results, and laboratory values). This is an OUT-OF-SCHEMA case — the concept cannot be verified from the available data.

content.text: I'll start by examining the database schema to understand what data is available.

input.description: List all tables in the database
Get full schema of all tables

content.content:
CREATE TABLE Examination
(
    ID                 INTEGER          null,
    `Examination Date` DATE         null,
    `aCL IgG`          REAL        null,
    `aCL IgM`          REAL        null,
    ANA                INTEGER          null,
    `ANA Pattern`      TEXT null,
    `aCL IgA`          INTEGER          null,
    Diagnosis          TEXT null,
    KCT                TEXT null,
    RVVT              TEXT null,
    LAC                TEXT null,
    Symptoms           TEXT null,
    Thrombosis         INTEGER          null,
    foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);
CREATE TABLE Patient
(
    ID           INTEGER default 0 not null
        primary key,
    SEX          TEXT  null,
    Birthday     DATE          null,
    Description  DATE          null,
    `First Date` DATE          null,
    Admission    TEXT  null,
    Diagnosis    TEXT  null
);
CREATE TABLE Laboratory
(
    ID        INTEGER  default 0            not null,
    Date      DATE default '0000-00-00' not null,
    GOT       INTEGER                       null,
    GPT       INTEGER                        null,
    LDH       INTEGER                        null,
    ALP       INTEGER                        null,
    TP        REAL             null,
    ALB       REAL             null,
    UA        REAL             null,
    UN        INTEGER                       null,
    CRE       REAL             null,
    `T-BIL`   REAL             null,
    `T-CHO`   INTEGER                       null,
    TG        INTEGER                       null,
    CPK       INTEGER                       null,
    GLU       INTEGER                       null,
    WBC       REAL             null,
    RBC       REAL             null,
    HGB       REAL             null,
    HCT       REAL             null,
    PLT       INTEGER                       null,
    PT        REAL             null,
    APTT      INTEGER                       null,
    FG        REAL             null,
    PIC       INTEGER                       null,
    TAT       INTEGER                       null,
    TAT2      INTEGER                       null,
    `U-PRO`   TEXT              null,
    IGG       INTEGER                       null,
    IGA       INTEGER                       null,
    IGM       INTEGER                       null,
    CRP       TEXT              null,
    RA        TEXT              null,
    RF        TEXT              null,
    C3        INTEGER                       null,
    C4        INTEGER                       null,
    RNP       TEXT              null,
    SM        TEXT              null,
    SC170     TEXT              null,
    SSA       TEXT              null,
    SSB       TEXT              null,
    CENTROMEA TEXT              null,
    DNA       TEXT              null,
    `DNA-II`  INTEGER                       null,
    primary key (ID, Date),
        foreign key (ID) references Patient (ID)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text:
Now I can see the schema. The claim mentions "average household income" — let me check if any column in any table relates to household income.

Looking at the schema:
- **Patient** table: ID, SEX, Birthday, Description, First Date, Admission, Diagnosis
- **Examination** table: ID, Examination Date, various clinical measures, Symptoms, Thrombosis
- **Laboratory** table: ID, Date, various lab values including SC170

The claim references **"average household income"** and **"national median"**. There is **no column** in any of the three tables that contains household income data. The database is entirely clinical/medical in nature, containing patient demographics (sex, birthday), examination results, and laboratory values.

This is a clear **OUT-OF-SCHEMA** case — the concept of "household income" does not exist anywhere in the database.

```json
{"label": "NOT ENOUGH INFO", "reasoning": "The claim references 'average household income' and 'national median income,' but the database contains no income-related data whatsoever. The database only has clinical/medical data (patient demographics, examination results, and laboratory values). This is an OUT-OF-SCHEMA case — the concept cannot be verified from the available data."}
```
